content: toad witch or wizard hat & cape this pattern was written by me mage wood whimsies who hopes that you enjoy making it as much as i enjoyed designing it © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 1 stitches used & abbreviations k knit st s stitch es rs right side p purl repeat repeat ret return k2tog knit 2 stitches together single knit decrease p2tog purl 2 stitches together single purl decrease pnso pass next stitch over that is on the left needle ln left needle rn right needle materials used needles 2 5mm double-point needles us size 1 5 - double-pointed needles can be used for the whole witch hat and cape pattern but if preferred regular straight needles can be used for the cape part of the pattern and just use the double-points for the hat *for the toad dragon s black/orange hat i used 3mm double-point needles us size 2 5 as my toad dragon has a bit bigger head than my other toads but used 2 5mm for cape yarns any fingering weight yarn i knit with 2 strands of fingering weight yarn held together for the whole pattern *when you use black yarn with another dark colour it gives the knitting a velvety look yarns i used yarn and colors must-have in black 100 with millamia naturally soft sock in gun powder 533 for the black/grey hat and woolike in black with millamia naturally soft sock in gun powder 533 for the black/grey cape both used on the green toad familiar for black/purple hat and cape i used yarn and colors must- have in black 100 with woolike in purple for the hat and woolike in black with woolike in purple for the cape both used to illustrate this pattern i used yarn and colors must-have in black 100 with cascade 220 fingering in ginger 2414 for the black/orange hat and woolike in black with cascade 220 fingering in ginger 2414 for the black/orange cape both used for the toad dragon extras small bead or button for cape clasp yarn needle for sewing 1 5 mm crochet hook to make the tie for the cape *you can also make tie with i-cord © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 2 witch/wizard hat cast on 24 stitches i use a long-tailed cast on method using 2 strands of any fingering weight yarn of your choice i used the yarns for the black/purple witch hat arrange the 24 stitches on to 3 of the 2 5 mm double point needles to knit in the round as in fig 1 rounds 1-10 k all 10 rounds 24 sts round 11 k2tog k6 x 3 21 sts round 12 k2tog k5 x 3 18 sts round 13 k2tog k4 x 3 15 sts round 14 k2tog k3 x 3 12 sts round 15 k2tog k2 x 3 9 sts rounds 16-19 k all 4 rounds 9 sts round 20 k2tog k1 x 3 6 sts rounds
